/>
X.i.6.J.1.b
.
Establishing Rating EPs for Final Rating Decisions
The DRAS must establish the appropriate rating end product (EP) and enter contentions in the Veterans Benefits Management System (VBMS) in accordance with
M21-1, Part II, Subpart iii, 3.A
.  When establishing the rating EP, the DRAS must use:
the day after the participant’s discharge as the date of claim, and
the applicable IDES
claim label.
Important
:
Before establishing rating EPs in IDES cases, the DRAS must ensure the participant’s service is verified and the EP 689 has been cleared.
Exception
:  If the participant is a member of National Guard or Reserves, and participated in IDES as a Veteran who was not on active duty, the rating EP should be established in accordance with
M21-1, Part X, Subpart i, 6.K.2.d
.
References
:  For more information on actions to take when the IDES participant
has accepted the Physical Evaluation Board decision that they are unfit for duty, see
M21-1, Part X, Subpart i, 6.I.2.e
, and
meets retention standards, is fit for duty, or has been disenrolled, see
M21-1, Part X, Subpart i, 6.I.2.a
.
title: M21-1, Part X, Subpart i, Chapter 6, Section J - Integrated Disability Evaluation System (IDES) Final Ratings
citation: Part X, Subpart i, Chapter 6, Section J
